channel.title: Future bounce! Can it be done in Auxy?
channel.description: Was just listening to some, and can’t figure out how to get it into Auxy. I know that the bouncy bass and massive sidechain is needed but how do you get that in Auxy?

item.title: Future bounce! Can it be done in Auxy?
item.dc:creator: Bastyon
item.description:
Sounds NAAIICE

I reckon the bass that’s real good for future bounce is panda and breath (bomb as sub)

And I wanna get that Martin Garrix Byte lead by using panda high pitch as a lead.

I’ll share the audio file once I get it nearly finished. Excited to show you guys! (The song has a more happy vibe. So that’s why I wanted to use more expressive basses. Needy does sound good though

I feel like I got the basics down but I definitely missed some parts, and I took away that needy is the bass we need for this genre…

spoiler

Anyways what y’all guys think?

item.title: Future bounce! Can it be done in Auxy?
item.dc:creator: Peregrihn
item.description:
As for the sidechain issue, use your preferred kick and do set it to trigger ducker, then volume automate at every kick so that it gives an optimal, adjustable space.

Read full topic
item.source: Future bounce! Can it be done in Auxy?

item.title: Future bounce! Can it be done in Auxy?
item.dc:creator: foryou
item.description:
use sweet saw or silk (i guess something like gossip or strain could work too if you highpassed it a bit and layered it with sweet saws). also don’t be afraid to raise basses by like 3 octaves and make them into leads. some of the basses in the og soundpack work great as leads!

Read full topic

item.source: Future bounce! Can it be done in Auxy?

item.title: Future bounce! Can it be done in Auxy?
item.dc:creator: INDIR3CT
item.description:
Making a track fully with triplets, or with default notes with a swing of 5-7 works pretty well for getting that “bouncy” vibe. For a decent sidechain, use 2 different kicks. Here is what I mean… Have your main kick set with the volume ducker off. Have another kick with the volume all the way off, so its there… but you can’t hear it. With that kick make it a bit offset, and turn the volume ducker on for that. That way the sidechain hits a bit earlier than normal, making it sound more heavy, because when it does ducker, all you will hear is your main kick that doesn’t use sidechain. If that makes sense. If not, I can share a example of what I mean, It makes insane sidechains! Auxy’s built in sidechain settings are a bit… light? So I do this to make it really compressed and impacting. Other than that, conduct the melodies and chords like you would in a future bass track. Another little tip I normally do for a future bounce type track is to layer an 808 bass with a Reese bass, so you have the low frequency, then some ritty gritty stuff on top.

Read full topic
